pages.text: If you recall from my diary notes, the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow is not a mere fantasy. I observed leprechauns use it to retrieve bounty that they no doubt stole from unsuspecting travellers, and I think I know how they did this.

First, they put a chest near the pot of gold. Then, they would use an imbued tree root on the pot. I wrote an entry about those on another page. The root makes the pot dispense a specific desired item. Doing so will visualize that item over the pot, a nifty trick if you ask me.

I also noticed if the greedy little critters pulled too much treasure and the chest would fill up, black smoke particles would show above the pot. The lack of a nearby chest seemed to have the same effect.

They wouldn't limit themselves to just a single type of treasure either. They used multiple roots on the pot, and it seemed to be willingly dispense a good amount of unique items. I also saw them crouching and touch the pot with both hands empty to get their tree roots back, one at a time.
